turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Syros.
turn.1: What developed on Syros during the early 19th century?
turn.2: Since 1830 the commerce of fabrics, silk, ship building, leather and iron developed on Syros and at the same time a powerful banking system was created.
turn.3: What was the city's main commercial harbor called?
turn.4: The tremendous growth and development of Ermoupolis continued and until 1860 Syros was the most important commercial harbour in Greece.
turn.5: What other industries developed on the island?
turn.6: Together with commerce and ship building, construction and public works were also developed.
turn.7: Did a shipping company headquarters form on the island?
turn.8: The Greek Steamship Company was founded in 1856.
turn.10: A period of decline then followed, as sailing gave way to steam, the importance of the geographical situation of the island was reduced and Piraeus harbour finally took the predominant position in Greece - with the competition of Patras also reducing Syros' commercial importance.
turn.12: Beginning at the end of the 19th century and for several decades, a temporary economic recovery took place, due to the development of the textile industry ("Foustanos-Karellas-Velissaropoulos & Co").
